benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/customFields - Modify custom fields to invoice item

covered: Valid Request: Multiple TC scenarios cover successful updates with valid payloads and required headers (TC01, TC03, TC05, TC04, TC02, TC09, TC11, TC12, TC15, TC16, TC17, TC18, TC21, TC22, TC23).
Non-Existing Resource: Tests for non-existent invoice items (TC07, TC24, TC25).
Malformed/Invalid Input: Malformed JSON (TC08), missing required header (TC09), empty body (TC10), invalid id format (TC06), unsupported fields (TC11).
Edge/Boundary Cases: Minimum/maximum payloads (TC22, TC21), extra URL parameters (TC23).
System/Dependency Issues: System error (TC15), timeout (TC16), integration/service unavailability (TC19).
Performance and Stability: Parallel/large payload tests (TC20, TC21).
Idempotency and Regression: Idempotency (TC17), regression of data loss (TC18).
gaps: Partial Update semantics: No explicit test ensuring partial updates are rejected or ignored if not allowed. (Only full array updates are exercised in most scenarios.)
Concurrency/race conditions: No dedicated test simulates concurrent updates to the same invoice item to expose race conditions.
Rate limiting: No tests addressing rate limiting or throttling behavior across rapid successive PUTs.
Caching behavior: No tests validating ETag/Cache-Control or related caching headers for PUT responses.
recommendations: Add a scenario to explicitly verify partial update behavior (e.g., sending a payload that omits certain fields or sends a subset) to ensure API enforces full replacement or supports partial updates as per design.
Introduce a concurrency/Race Condition test where two clients attempt to update the same invoiceItemId/customFields simultaneously and verify consistency and proper handling.
Add rate limiting tests (e.g., multiple rapid PUT requests from different clients) to ensure proper throttling or 429 responses if configured.
Add tests for caching headers on PUT responses (ETag, Cache-Control) and ensure clients handle caching semantics appropriately.
